body:
I believe it works on the assumption that the 'unknown' category follows the same racial breakdown as known categories. 

E.g. 39.6 / (29.1+39.6+2.1) which actually comes out to 0.559 or 55.9%. So I'm guessing it's a rounding error on the part of OP? Or maybe my entire approach to calculating is wrong.

body:
It's still a bit of a misnomer to say '13% of the population', because most people of all races don't commit any violent crime at all, and a small segment of each demographic group commits a great deal. In my home city of Baltimore, for example there are maybe 5,000-10,000 professional drug dealers and associated gang enforcers out of a black population of several hundred thousand people who are law abiding. 

Acknowledging this nuance and taking civil liberties more seriously would do a great deal to bring conservative and libertarian black people out of the democratic party. Change my mind.

post.title: The FBI just released the 2019 crime data. Despite making up 13% of the population, blacks committed 55.6% of all murders.

body:
Okay. There are about 41 million black Americans. That's the 13%. Some of them are babies, old people, etc. who don't, as a rule, commit murders. There are about 7.1 million black men age 15-35 who would account for most of the violent criminal behavior in the 41 million. Most of the 7.1 million also don't commit any violent crimes. There were 16,245 murders, so clearly each of the 7.1 million isn't all that likely to commit a murder either. 

My point is that while it's technically true that *when viewed as a group* blacks are statistically more likely to commit murder, but that obscures the fact that a tiny fraction of the people who "fit the description" actually do any murdering, and something in the range of 99.9% of them never will.
body_html:

My point is that while it's technically true that when viewed as a group blacks are statistically more likely to commit murder, but that obscures the fact that a tiny fraction of the people who "fit the description" actually do any murdering, and something in the range of 99.9% of them never will.

parent.body:
I believe it works on the assumption that the 'unknown' category follows the same racial breakdown as known categories. 

E.g. 39.6 / (29.1+39.6+2.1) which actually comes out to 0.559 or 55.9%. So I'm guessing it's a rounding error on the part of OP? Or maybe my entire approach to calculating is wrong.

parent.body:
It's still a bit of a misnomer to say '13% of the population', because most people of all races don't commit any violent crime at all, and a small segment of each demographic group commits a great deal. In my home city of Baltimore, for example there are maybe 5,000-10,000 professional drug dealers and associated gang enforcers out of a black population of several hundred thousand people who are law abiding. 

Acknowledging this nuance and taking civil liberties more seriously would do a great deal to bring conservative and libertarian black people out of the democratic party. Change my mind.
